page.title: 17COAL MINING
page.content: {Coal}was discovered in the area around 1226,when surface outcrops began to be mined simply by digging up the coal out of the ground.Over the centuries pits proliferated & prospered mainly due to the fact that the{coal seams {lay very close to the surface,}making good quality hard coal easily recoverable.Demand increased with the coming of the industrial revolution, although mechanisation was slow in coming to{S.Derbyshire,}and it was the second quarter of the C.20th. before modern mining methods were introduced. Coal mining has dominated both lives & landscape in Swadlincote for well over a century,and gives employment to thousands of local inhabitants.Some people did not benefit from the mining being forced to evacuate their homes due to subsidence.{Only 2 pits & 2 {open cast mines now remain.
